title: Electric PE - work and Delta-U for paths 1 and 2

content.question: A region of space contains two positive point charges, one that can be moved around and a second point charge that remains at a fixed position. The figure shows two possible paths, Path <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Path <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, through which the movable point charge can be moved by an external force from an initial position to a final position that is closer to the fixed point charge. Which of the following statements is correct about both the work <math alttext="W sub external" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi>ext</mi></msub></math> done by the external force and the change <math alttext="delta U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>U</mi></math> in electric potential energy of the two-point charge system?

choices.label: <math alttext="W sub external" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi>ext</mi></msub></math> is the same for paths <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, while <math alttext="delta U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>U</mi></math> is greater for Path <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> than for Path <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

<math alttext="W sub external" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi>ext</mi></msub></math> is greater for Path <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> than for Path <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, while <math alttext="delta U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>U</mi></math> is the same for paths <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

Both <math alttext="W sub external" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi>ext</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="delta U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>U</mi></math> are the same for paths <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

Both <math alttext="W sub external" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi>ext</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="delta U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>U</mi></math> are greater for Path <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> than for Path <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

content.answer: Both <math alttext="W sub external" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi>ext</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="delta U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>U</mi></math> are the same for paths <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
